thread.title: Max Allegri fuels Arsenal speculation despite Juventus chief telling Gunners ‘there’s no reason’ for him to leave
thread.title_full: Max Allegri fuels Arsenal speculation despite Juventus chief telling Gunners ‘there’s no reason’ for him to leave

author: gsweet
title: Max Allegri fuels Arsenal speculation despite Juventus chief telling Gunners ‘there’s no reason’ for him to leave
text:
Comments MASSIMILIANO ALLEGRI will not be replacing Arsene Wenger at Arsenal, according to Juventus general manager Giuseppe Marotta. 
But the Italian has appeared to fuel speculation by failing to commit one way or the other. Reuters Massimiliano Allegri is tipped to replace Arsene Wenger 
Marotta played the situation down, insisting there is no need for for their head coach to leave. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Mediaset quote Marotta as saying: “Aside from the fact we have a contract with Allegri, I think there are still great targets we need to achieve together and our rapport is very good. 
“There is no reason for him to leave Juventus, as there is great mutual admiration and affection.” 
But speaking after Juve’s win against Crotone, Allegri did not stick to the same hymn sheet. 
He said: WI won’t deny or confirm anything. I am in sync with the club, now we have to focus on winning. 
“At this time of the season the media always says I’m leaving, even when things are going really well.” 
Related Stories THIS ACTUALLY HAPPENED Wayne Rooney and Zlatan cut a giant CHEESE then play suited and booted in one of PR's strangest stunts NIFTY SHADES OF GRAY Leicester 3 Derby 1 (AET): Demarai Gray sends Foxes to FA Cup fifth round to ease some of the pressure on Claudio Ranieri DEPAYET GOALS Premier League misfits Dimitri Payet and Memphis Depay score first goals in Ligue 1 All change at Anfield Daniel Sturridge out and Joe Hart in as Jurgen Klopp plots massive summer shake-up at Liverpool BRACE YOURSELF Paul Pogba prepares for Man Utd's match with Watford by showing off his gold braces... as David De Gea reveals his new glasses at training MY SUICIDE HELL Six Nations hero Iain Milne tells all about his depression, mega boozing and massive binge eating CON EIRE Should Floyd Mayweather be scared? Conor McGregor steps up training for mega-fight at 'home' gym in Dublin 
It seems Allegri is the front-runner to replace Arsene Wenger in the summer should the Frenchman calls time on his 21 years at the helm. 
Wenger’s contract is due to expire at the end of the season, and many fans have been left disgruntled at a failure to regularly mount a serious challenge for the Premier League title they last won in 2004. 
The Gunners lost 3-1 at leaders Chelsea last Saturday to blow to any lingering hopes of catching the Blues. Gallas accuses Wenger of not having same winning mentality as Mourinho Getty Images Will Wenger call time on his 21-year adventure? Cesc Fabregas scores against his old team Arsenal after a blunder from Petr Cech Getty Images 3 Mesut Ozil...criticised by Arsenal legend Martin Keown 
Former AC Milan boss Allegri has won two Serie A titles since taking over at Juve in 2014. Allegri vs Pogba: Juve got a challenge
